page.title: 07Meppershall 1
page.content:
Meppershall is long and straggly, built along a ridge top. The recently developed part has moved away from the church and Manor House, leaving these set among open fields. The water tower is a dominating feature of the landscape.
Surrounded by fertile ground, agriculture has always been important, even today three farms and eleven horticultural nurseries remain.
There is a small factory in the village which also provides work. Nulectrohms Ltd. makes electric componenents and employs thirty-five people.
